data.title: Where was Modern Family filmed?
data.meta_description: Follow the journey of the hit sitcom Modern Family and explore the filming locations from coast to coast. Get a behind-the-scenes look at your favorite episodes!

About Modern Family

The American Broadcasting Company (ABC) aired a sitcom series called "Modern Family" for 11 seasons, from September 23, 2009, to April 8, 2020. The show, created by Christopher Lloyd and Steven Levitan, focuses on the daily lives of three unique family units in suburban Los Angeles. All of these families are connected through their patriarch, Jay Pritchett. "Modern Family" was created based on Christopher Lloyd and Steven Levitan's discussions about their modern-day families. The show boasts an ensemble cast and utilizes a mockumentary style, where the characters frequently engage with the audience by speaking directly to the camera during confessional interview scenes. The show's final season premiered on September 25, 2019, after being renewed on February 5, 2019. The series finale was broadcasted on April 8, 2020. During its initial seasons, "Modern Family" was widely praised by critics. Although critical reception became more varied as the show progressed, it maintained a dedicated fan base throughout its 11-season run and remained popular. The last season garnered positive reviews, and the series finale attracted 7.37 million viewers during its first airing. Additionally, the documentary aired before the finale had 6.72 million viewers during its initial airing. Throughout its run, "Modern Family" received a plethora of awards. It won the Emmy Award for Outstanding Comedy Series in each of its first five seasons and amassed a total of 22 Emmy Awards from 75 nominations. Julie Bowen won two awards for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series, while Eric Stonestreet and Ty Burrell each won two awards for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series. The show won the Golden Globe Award for Best Television Series - Musical or Comedy 2011. In 2013, NBCUniversal's USA Network, Fox Television Stations, and other local networks in different markets acquired the broadcast syndication rights to "Modern Family" for a fall premiere. The show's popularity resulted in it being the 10th highest revenue-generating program of 2012, with each episode earning $2.13 million.

Modern Family Locations

Modern Family is one of the most beloved television series in recent years, and it has a lot of production value from its filming locations. Most scenes for the show were shot in Los Angeles, California, which makes sense given its large population and numerous film studios. Despite being set in suburban Los Angeles, the series adds some variety to its visual landscape by shooting in various locations throughout Southern California. From beachfront cities like Santa Monica and Malibu to picturesque towns such as San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara County, Modern Family shows viewers vibrant landscapes that capture the beauty and charm of these regions. The show presents realistic depictions of Southern California's diverse geography and features iconic landmarks such as La Brea Tar Pits and Universal Studios Hollywood. Furthermore, many episodes feature lush greenspaces like Griffith Park and Huntington Library & Gardens, where characters can explore nature or take a nice picnic lunch. With all this in mind, a trip to these places used as settings for Modern Family would be incredibly worthwhile for anyone interested in exploring what these areas offer.

Without a helipad, Charlie landed his helicopter on the building's roof, giving Mitchell only 30 minutes to discuss business before returning to his vacation in Cabo. To make matters worse, Charlie hit on Haley when she arrived. Despite being ten years older than Mitchell, Charlie tried to impress Haley with his clothing line. Still, Haley found it unappealing and ended up providing him with suggestions for improving it. The 20th Century Fox Studios in Los Angeles, California, is one of Hollywood's most iconic and historic studios. It was founded as Fox Film Corporation in 1915 by William Fox and later merged with Twentieth Century Pictures in 1935 to form 20th Century Fox. The studio has also been home to many popular TV shows over the years, including "The X-Files," "Married...with Children," and "Modern Family." Modern Family is a comedy TV series shot in various locations over the years. The show is set and filmed primarily in Los Angeles, California, but it has also used other places around the state and country. In 2008, during the first season, many outdoor scenes were filmed at various locations in California, such as Griffith Park and Malibu Creek State Park. In 2010 New York City was used for an episode involving Phil's trip to meet his online date. Other places outside California include Las Vegas for Jay's bachelor party, Idaho for a mountain vacation, Florida for a family cruise, Utah to fulfill Dylan's dream of going to Space Camp, Wyoming, Montana for Jay's hunting trip, and Hawaii for their family vacation and Alex's graduation trip. The range of locations used throughout the 11-year run of Modern Family highlights how much this show has spread out beyond its Los Angeles home base. It showcases attention to detail by making sure that each moment feels unique to both the characters involved and audience members alike. From sunny days at Griffith Park to wild adventures in New York City or Hawaii, Modern Family offers viewers a way to escape into another world while never straying too far from home.
